content.description: Stand start on an obvious right foothold, with a two hand undercling in the crack. Move up and right until the main crack splits, and then move left along the crack to a left-hand jug about halfway up the wall. Work your feet up to the left from there and use crimps to get to the lip. The aforementioned left-hand jug can be used as a right foothold once you get your left foot smeared solidly.
content.location: Up the middle of Perspective boulder. Start up and right along the crack from the base and then move up to the left on foot smears and side pulls to the finish.

content.description: A solid, fairly clean highball wall of old rag granite in the bear cave area. Tallest boulder face in the bear cave area by an obvious margin.
